page.title: 05Building Tradition,Stebbing
page.content: Stebbing has a wealth of timber framed houses.There is no local stone and the basic building materials available were oak, elm and flint,used almost exclusively over the centuries.Timber frame construction flourishes in Stebbing to the present day.If you remove all the walls and roof of a timber framed house the load bearing frame remains.Unseasoned timber was used and as the oak warped,unusual house shapes formed.Infill material was wattle and daub,changing to lath and plaster.Damp proof courses were not used until the 20th century.The horizontal sole plate stopped rising damp.There are local builders skilled in repairing these old houses as well as constructing new houses using brick and modern materials.
